intro: Perrottetia alpestris var. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine alpine perrottetia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to cooler, more arid conditions. Its leaves are usually small, elliptical, and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
